get.description: Returns a paginated list of addresses with their balances. Can be filtered to show only contract addresses.

parameters.description: If true, return only addresses that are smart contracts (default: false)
parameters.name: only_contracts

200.description: List of addresses with their balances

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific address including its balance, contract status, and activity history
Returns a paginated list of blocks. Blocks can be sorted by height in ascending or descending order. Optionally includes statistics for each block.

parameters.description: Include statistics for each block (default: false)
parameters.name: stats

get.description: Returns the total number of blocks indexed in the blockchain, including the genesis block
Returns detailed information about a specific block at the given height. Optionally includes statistical data such as transaction count, gas usage, and fees.

parameters.description: Include block statistics (transaction count, gas usage, fees) (default: false)
parameters.name: stats

get.description: Returns statistical data for a specific block including transaction count, gas used, gas limit, base fee, and total fees
Returns a paginated list of all transactions included in the specified block

200.description: List of transactions in the block

get.description: Returns a paginated list of deployed smart contracts. Can be filtered by verification status or deployment transaction.

parameters.description: Filter to show only verified contracts (default: false)
parameters.name: is_verified

parameters.description: Filter by deployment transaction hash (hexadecimal with 0x prefix)
parameters.name: tx_hash

parameters.description: Filter by deployer address (hexadecimal with 0x prefix)
parameters.name: deployer

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific smart contract including deployment info, verification status, and metadata
Returns the verified source code files for a specific smart contract. Only available for verified contracts.

parameters.description: Number of source files to return (default: 10)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of source files to skip (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

204.description: Contract not found or not verified

get.description: Returns all possible enumeration values used in the API including transaction types, transaction statuses, trace types, token types, transfer types, proxy contract types, and proxy contract statuses. Use these values for filtering in other API endpoints.

200.description: All enumeration values available in the API

get.description: Returns the current state of the blockchain indexer including the latest indexed block height and timestamp. Useful for checking indexer synchronization status.
Returns a paginated list of event logs emitted by smart contracts. Can be filtered by transaction, address, block height, or time range.

parameters.description: Filter by transaction hash (hexadecimal with 0x prefix)
parameters.name: tx_hash

parameters.description: Filter by contract address that emitted the log
parameters.name: address

get.description: Returns a paginated list of proxy contracts. Proxy contracts are smart contracts that delegate calls to implementation contracts. Can be filtered by type, status, implementation address, or deployment height.

parameters.description: Number of proxy contracts to return (default: 10)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of proxy contracts to skip (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Sort order by deployment height (default: desc)
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Filter by resolution status: new (just detected), resolved (implementation found), error (failed to resolve) (comma-separated)
parameters.name: status

get.description: Performs a universal search across the blockchain. Supports searching by: block height (numeric), transaction hash (0x prefixed hex), address (0x prefixed hex), or token name/symbol (text). Returns matching blocks, transactions, addresses, and tokens.

parameters.description: Search query: block height (e.g., 12345), transaction/block hash (e.g., 0x1234...), address (e.g., 0x742d...), or token name/symbol (e.g., USDC)
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 10, max: 100)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

200.description: Search results (can include blocks, transactions, addresses, tokens)

get.description: Returns the average block time over a specified period. Useful for analyzing blockchain performance and trends.
Returns a paginated list of token balances showing how many tokens each address holds. Can be filtered by address, contract, or token ID. Useful for finding token holders.
Returns a paginated list of tokens (ERC20, ERC721, ERC1155). Can be filtered by token type or issuing contract address.

parameters.description: Filter by contract address that issued the token
parameters.name: contract

parameters.description: Sort order by creation time (default: desc)
parameters.name: sort

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific token including metadata, supply, and holder information. For ERC20 tokens use token_id=0, for ERC721/ERC1155 use the specific token ID.
get.summary: Get token by contract and ID

400.description: Invalid contract address or token ID

get.description: Returns a paginated list of execution traces showing internal calls, contract creations, and other EVM operations. Traces provide detailed insight into transaction execution. Can be filtered by transaction, addresses, contract, block height, or trace type.

parameters.description: Filter by transaction hash (hexadecimal with 0x prefix)
parameters.name: tx_hash

get.description: Returns a paginated list of token transfer events (mint, burn, transfer). Can be filtered by transfer type, addresses, contract, token ID, transaction, block height, or time range.

parameters.description: Filter by transaction hash (hexadecimal with 0x prefix)
parameters.name: tx_hash

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific token transfer event by its internal database ID

Returns a paginated list of blockchain transactions. Can be filtered by addresses, contract, block height, transaction type, status, or time range. Supports various transaction types including legacy, EIP-1559 (dynamic fee), EIP-4844 (blob), and EIP-7702 (set code).
Returns detailed information about a specific transaction including status, gas used, value transferred, and associated traces

parameters.description: Transaction hash in hexadecimal with 0x prefix
parameters.name: hash

get.description: Returns a paginated list of ERC-4337 user operations. Can be filtered by transaction, block height, time range, bundler, paymaster, or success status.

parameters.description: Filter by transaction hash (hexadecimal with 0x prefix)
parameters.name: tx

parameters.description: Number of user operations to return (default: 10)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of user operations to skip (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific ERC-4337 user operation

parameters.description: User operation hash in hexadecimal with 0x prefix
parameters.name: hash

get.description: Establishes a WebSocket connection for real-time updates. Clients can subscribe to channels to receive notifications about new blocks and head state changes.

responses.Enums.description: Available enum values for various entity types

result.description: Search result. Can be one of folowwing types: Address, Block, Tx, Token

type.description: Result type which is in the result. Can be 'address', 'block', 'tx', 'token'
